intro: Junellia seriphioides var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth junellia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
